intro: Lotononis carnea, commonly known as the pink lotonon, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple tubular flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy habitats, demonstrating adaptability to harsh environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
